Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PlainTextDataset::PlainTextDataset ( const std::string &  filename  )  [explicit]

Parameters:
filename Path in the filesystem to the file containing the dataset.
Precondition:
The file passed must have the number of features in its first line.
Exceptions:
NessieException 
This constructor loads a dataset from a file, which must have the following format:

The first line defines the number of features in every sample of the data set.

The following lines are the samples (one sample per line). Every line has a number of fields according to the definition in the first line, which constitutes a feature vector, and one additional field that tells the class of the feature vector. An example of a valid data set may be:

4
0.1 0.3 1.3 2.4 3
1.5 2.8 6.2 2.4 1
3.3 1.2 0.9 1.1 3
. . .

The feature fields must have a floating point format: both the integer and decimal parts are required and separated by a point. The class field must be an integer.

Postcondition:
The sample is appended to the end of the dataset.
